oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Penetration of Danofloxacin Into Tissues of the Respiratory and Gastrointestinal Tract in Calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Friis, Christian
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: fluoroquinolone
pneumonia
enteritis
pharmacokinetics
respiratory tissue
gastrointestinal tract
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Danofloxacin* (CP-76,136) is a new fluoroquinolone which possesses high in vitro activity against the major bacterial pathogens in farm animals (1). The spectrum and potency of this drug indicate potential utility in the treatment of a broad range of infections, including pneumonia and enteritis. To guide effective therapy, this study focuses on the pharmacokinetics of danofloxacin in calves and the penetration of the drug into tissues of the respiratory and gastrointestinal tract.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1992: Volume 1; 102-107
